author: Sefy Levy
description: Identify unreliable pXRF/XRF measurements using relative standard deviation
reference: Potts & West, 2008 (pXRF QA/QC); NIST uncertainty guidelines

classifications.name: RESEARCH GRADE (RSD < 15%)
classifications.description: High-quality data suitable for research publication

classifications.name: SCREENING GRADE (15-25%)
classifications.description: Acceptable for screening and triage, caution for quantitative work
classifications.notes: Use for provenance triage but verify critical samples with lab analysis

classifications.name: NON-QUANTIFIABLE (RSD > 25%)
classifications.description: High uncertainty - not suitable for quantitative interpretation
classifications.notes: Flag for re-measurement or exclusion from dataset

classifications.name: NO ERROR DATA
classifications.notes: Cannot assess data quality without error measurements

notes: RSD = Relative Standard Deviation = (error / value). This is a screening-level filter - not absolute law. Can be applied to any element with error measurements. Flag noisy pXRF scans before they enter provenance analysis.
